linebacker Desmond Bishop stepped into the picture and with a mighty one-handed swipe took DeSean Jackson down with a shoestring tackle at the Packers' 38-yard line.`` That was big,'' Packers defensive end Ryan Pickett said. Actually it saved the game. That's a touchdown-saving tackle. Thanks to Desmond Bishop , DeSean Jackson was stopped in his tracks after a 28-yard reception. Four plays later Eagles quarterback Michael Vick threw his fateful interception to Tramon Williams in the end zone to seal the Packers' 21-16 victory
